page.title: 19Tourism in Lacock cont.
page.content: {Tourism}is really the backbone of the village. Without it there would be little remaining. However the residents would sometimes wish for a quieter village with its visitors less noticeable. A car park on the edge of the village would be seen as a blessing and would relieve the congestion at the centre. The beauty of the village would also be enhanced if fewer cars and coaches were in evidence. On the other hand, the tourists revel in witnessing life in full swing and many a picture is taken of the children at school.
